problem.question: What is output by the code to the right?
problem.code:
boolean p = true;
boolean q = false;
out.println((p&&q||p) + " " + (p||q&&p));
problem.e: There is no output due to syntax error.

problem.question: What is output by the code to the right?
problem.code:
boolean a = false, b = true, c = false;
a = b && c || b && !a;
System.out.println( a==true );

problem.question: What values for a, b, and c make the output to the right true?
problem.code:
boolean a, b, c, d;
d = b && c || a;
out.println(d);

problem.question: When is the variable d true?
problem.code:
boolean x,y,z,d;
d = x && z || z && (!x || x && y);
out.println(d);
problem.a: only when x is true and z is false

and b will result in c being set to true?
problem.code:

//code to initialize a and b
boolean c = (!a || !b) || a;

problem.question:
Which answer is logically equivalent to the following Boolean expression,
where a, b, and c are boolean variables?

Which answer is logically equivalent to the following 
Boolean expression, where x, y and z are int variables?
Which statement is represented by the truth table to the right?
problem.code:
a      b       c
true   true    true
true   false   true
false  true    true
false  false   false

problem.question:
Which statement below represents the truth table to the right?
 a, b, and c are all variables of type boolean.
problem.code:
a       b       c
false   false   false
false   true    true
true    false   true
true    true    false

problem.question:
Assume x, y, and z are int variables. 
Which answer is logically equivalent to this Boolean expression?
problem.code: !( x + y < z && x * y >= z )

variables a, b, and c will result in d being set
to true?

problem.question: Which of these statements sets b to true?
What is output by the code to the right?
problem.code:
int x2 = 3;
double a2 = 2.5;
boolean b2 = x2 < a2 || x2 * a2 < 100;
System.out.print( b2 );
problem.e:
There is no output due to a 
syntax error in the code.

problem.question: What is output by the code to the right?
problem.code:
boolean one = true;
boolean two = false;
out.println(!two&&(!two||!one));

problem.question: What is output by the code to the right?
problem.code:
boolean w = false;
boolean y = true;
boolean u = false;
u = (!(w||y)||((w&&!(w&&y))));
out.println(u==true?"yes":"no");

How many combinations of values for
the boolean variables a, b, and c will
result in d being set to true?

boolean d = ( a || b || c );
